content: this gently textured scarf is a great beginner-friendly project the unisex design works up quickly and the self-striping yarn does all the colorwork for you this dude-approved scarf designed to meet donation requirements for the knit your bit campaign at the national wwii museum 1 a program that distributes handmade scarves to veterans > **this pattern is available for free on my blog here 2 ** > > the free version is supported by > advertising on my website the > downloadable pdf for sale on ravelry > includes includes the full pattern in > one printable file without > advertisements **skills used** basic crochet stitches chain double_crochet single_crochet working in row **skill level** easy **finished size** adult 54 137 cm length x 8 20 cm width **materials** lion brand scarfie 5 3 oz/150 g/312 yds/285 m/100% acrylic 1 skein in 206 cream/taupe *or approximately 312 yds 285 m in any bulky weight yarn * us size k-10 5 6 5 mm crochet hook *or any size needed to obtain gauge * yarn needle **gauge** 11 sts x 9 row in pattern = 4 10 cm *exact gauge is not critical for this project * this pattern was originally published in october 2015 as part of my charity crochet series on oombawka design 3 1 http //www nationalww2museum org/learn/knit-your-bit/index html 2 http //undergroundcrafter com/blog/2016/01/20/free-pattern-walking-in-the-sand-scarf/ 3 http //oombawkadesigncrochet com/2015/10/knit-your-bit-campaign-at-the-national-wwii-museum-guest-contributor-post html
